definitions.definition: strength or energy as an attribute of physical action or movement.
examples: he was thrown backward by the force of the explosion
synonyms: impetus "he pushed with all his force"

definitions.definition: an influence tending to change the motion of a body or produce motion or stress in a stationary body. The magnitude of such an influence is often calculated by multiplying the mass of the body by its acceleration.
a person or thing regarded as exerting power or influence.
used with a number as a measure of wind strength on the Beaufort scale.
coercion or compulsion, especially with the use or threat of violence.
examples: they ruled by law and not by force
synonyms: bullying tactics "they used force to achieve their aims"

definitions.definition: mental or moral strength or power.
the state of being in effect or valid.
examples: the law came into force in January
synonyms: valid "the law is now in force"

definitions.definition: the powerful effect of something.
examples: the force of her writing is undiminished
synonyms: authority; Moreinformalpunch; formalefficacy "the force of the argument"

definitions.definition: an organized body of military personnel or police.
examples: a soldier in a UN peacekeeping force
synonyms: squad; border patrol; informalbunch "a peace-keeping force"

definitions.definition: troops and weaponry.
a group of people brought together and organized for a particular activity.
a police department.
a force-out.
a situation in which a force-out is possible.
make a way through or into by physical strength; break open by force.
examples: they broke into Fred's house and forced every cupboard door with ax or crowbar
synonyms: kick in "the door had to be forced"

definitions.definition: drive or push into a specified position or state using physical strength or against resistance.
examples: she forced her feet into flat leather sandals
synonyms: pump "water was forced through a hole"

definitions.definition: achieve or bring about (something) by coercion or effort.
push or strain (something) to the utmost.
examples: she knew if she forced it she would rip it

definitions.definition: artificially hasten the development or maturity of (a plant).
examples: extract, elicit, exact, extort, wrest, wring, drag, screw, squeeze they forced a confession out of the kids

definitions.definition: make (someone) do something against their will.
examples: she was forced into early retirement
synonyms: twist someone's arm "he was forced to pay"

definitions.definition: rape (a woman).
put out (a runner), or cause (a runner) to be put out, at the base to which they are advancing when they are forced to run on a batted ball.
examples: I was forced at second base as the first half of a double play

definitions.definition: (in cards) make a play or bid that compels another player to make (a particular response); make a play or bid that compels (another player) to make such a response.
examples: East could force declarer to ruff another spade
